column2: The Brittanic religion is a monotheistic offshoot of Druidic belief focused on the goddess Britannia, the personification of the British Isles. She is viewed as a mother goddess and is worshipped to the exclusion of all other gods from Celtic tradition. The priesthood is entirely composed of women known as Dryads, with the Arch-Dryad as the supreme spiritual authority. Brittanics also venerate a host of saints and Sanctaidd, divine servants of the Holy Mother that are much like angels in Abrahamic tradition. Most of the Sanctaidd are considered gods amongst the Druids.
The Circle of Dryads is the highest governing body in the Church of Britannia. It's sole duty is to elect the next Arch-Dryad.
This character is a dryad, a Britannic priestess.
This Dryad has conducted herself in ways unbecoming of her station.
This character is a Morrigan, a veteran of a Britannic Great Holy War.
Setup an Arch-Dryad as the head of Britannic religion.
